Flood damage to a home costs around ¬£30,000 to repair; the cost to a business is about ¬£82,000. 

Find out now how to be prepared- https://t.co/ZEHl74ryiJ

#FloodActionWeek #PrepareActSurvive https://t.co/JA0veyjv6a

tweets.text:
Why don't you sign up for flood warnings from the @EnvAgency - it's a free service and could save your life!

More information can be found here https://t.co/UHZ1JynKp5

#FloodActionWeek https://t.co/TTdd2XGzys

Being prepared for flooding and knowing what to do in flood can significantly reduce the damage to homes and possessions (by around 40%)
Find out what to do in a flood: https://t.co/29saU23JrY. #FloodActionWeek #PrepareActSurvive. https://t.co/32GGUwAdPU

It's @EnvAgencyNW  #FloodActionWeek 

Here are 5 helpful things you can do to be more prepared for #flooding!
1‚É£Move items
2‚É£Learn to turn off utilities
3‚É£Check flood insurance
4‚É£Sign up to flood warnings
5‚É£Share this message!

#FloodAware #PrepareActSurvuce https://t.co/E98GfgDKse

Did you know? 

üè†The average cost of flood damage to a home is ¬£30,000

üí∑ The average cost to a business is ¬£82,000

‚û°Ô∏è 12% people don't know if they are in a flood risk area

Taking steps to prepare can reduce damages (by around 40%) https://t.co/a5nLshEGSO

#FloodActionWeek https://t.co/HCBGJrA8r7

Would you believe that some residents in Shrewsbury are still out of their properties after Storm Dennis caused flooding in February earlier this year. Flooding has an impact far beyond the actual event & can take months to get back to some sort of normality. #PrepareActSurvive https://t.co/plnKsUK1l0

Would you know what to do? 

Taking action before a flood could keep the things you care about safe.

Find out what action to take https://t.co/wwueotBnkz

#PrepareActSurvive #Floodaware https://t.co/KhNZBReeJf

Press release from @BeaverTrust https://t.co/7ZyRCQdbvL

tweets.text:
It's #FloodActionWeek, and I've written a blog on how #TeamEA have been preparing for winter - from building & repairing new flood defences, to enhancing our #FloodWarning system and training 6,500 staff: https://t.co/pVdjmzZUIL

The @EnvAgency is ready for winter, are you?

Also discovered recently that @EnvAgency budget for environmental protection has been cut from ¬£100m to ¬£15m in past 10 yrs. Doesn't look good for promises about upholding environmental protections and being the first generation to leave the environment in a better state  2/2

urls.title: Great Canal Journeys
urls.description: Timothy West, Prunella Scales, Sheila Hancock and Gyles Brandreth tour spectacular canals

tweets.text:
#GreatCanalJourneys is back

Watch funny and charming hosts #SheilaHancock and @gylesb1 travel the upper #RiverThames

Look out for Thames Harbour Master Barry Russell: https://t.co/Z0s8le8ObW

More about our support for boaters: https://t.co/bhDKmh6t0u
Pic:@spungoldtv-Channel 4 https://t.co/sBFs1SJw9J

domain.name: TV Shows
domain.description: Television shows from around the world

entity.name: Great Canal Journeys
entity.description: Prunella Scales and Timothy West embark on canal journeys together, traversing the canals of the UK, Europe, and the rest of the world by canal barge and narrowboat. Their trips take them along many scenic waterways, including ancient routes followed by the Vikings in Sweden, the windmills along the canals near Amsterdam, and the route once taken by Casanova in Venice. Along the way they interact with interesting characters, taste regional dishes and explore the sights around the canals. Sheila Hancock and Gyles Brandreth host the twelfth season.

tweets.text: One year on from the South Yorkshire #floods, we're working to repair and improve #flood defences in the area to reduce flood risk this winter and beyond. Piling works have started in the village of #Fishlake, #Doncaster as part of our ¬£12m recovery works: https://t.co/Zqt4pI1Jx1 https://t.co/oJWTUC8EhT
Taking action before a flood could keep the things you care about safe. #FloodAware #PrepareActSurvive #Humber #HumberEstuary @EnvAgencyYNE https://t.co/llOVfTSi2C https://t.co/if99ImMloR

We're hosting our very first virtual resident meeting for the Otley Flood Alleviation scheme on Wednesday 18 November, from 4pm. Join us, @BAMNuttall and @EnvAgencyYNE as we give an update and answer all your questions. Sign up here https://t.co/4x3QvxTUfv #flooding #Leeds https://t.co/VV2L5pPF12

Day 1 will cover national approaches to #climatechange with speakers including @im_coasts @DrMeg_Alexander @EnvAgency and more! 

Info and Registration here
 -->https://t.co/TIljDQjHlx #CCAT2020 https://t.co/A0iJ8ONg1y

tweets.text: Yesterday we attended an incident involving suspected large scale dumping and burning of commercial waste on #Agricultural land. Thanks to @DerbyshireFRS for the call and their efforts in dealing with the fire. 3 arrested and a joint investigation is now underway with @EnvAgency https://t.co/Sk35jPMDKL

Similarly as a proud ex @EnvAgency employee it is shocking and anyone who has a go @NaturalEngland or @EnvAgency should think again - @Feargal_Sharkey and start working with these hard working and dedicated people who are trying to protect the environment. https://t.co/YCwaBdw6jD https://t.co/4vbz6jPfK8
@bill_brierley @EnvAgency @NaturalEngland PS. The EA's budget has actually gone up by about ¬£100 million since 2015. What the board choose to spend it on is another matter. https://t.co/MGT5norASc

tweets.text:
Do you know how to survive a flood? Survivalist Megan Hine explains the three things you need to know üëá 

Over 5 million UK homes are at risk of flooding. Don't assume it won't happen to you.

https://t.co/CsUTBjY5Ft 

#FloodActionWeek #PrepareActSurvive

@Meg_Hine https://t.co/Bf3koSXpds

Discuss UK climate change adaptation with @WEETFEvents on the 8th December! Speakers include @TomHandysides @Farmerphil1 @EnvAgency @DrFox_Tim @mike_morecroft @emilyshuckburgh @IsabellaODowd @ConorMccone Click here to find out more: https://t.co/haMIxAnyDO #onlineconference https://t.co/BJfAMas06y

tweets.text: And our final talk was from @GeorgiFauconier who showed us some amazing images of Microsporidia in European #smelt. This was work done with @ZSLScience @NHM_London @EnvAgency @GarethDDaviesEA @Bruneluni https://t.co/elZF5eAWQo

Our team have been carrying out macro-invertebrate  surveys in log-jams that were introduced to a stream. Great news - the habitat is looking fantastic! Surveys are a great way of finding out the health of the invertebrate populations. üëå @EnvAgency @HeritageFundNW @SouthWestPeak https://t.co/xn5fvnAR1J

In #Cumbria less than half of people that can get  @EnvAgencyNW  flood warnings have signed up - take a moment and check your flood risk https://t.co/zaxJJ74tci #PrepareActSurvive https://t.co/dv7WRR5Te5
